verses.verse: Then I-yov <S%H347><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> <S%H8799><s%> and said <S%H559><s%> <S%H8799><s%>,
I have heard <S%H8085><s%> <S%H8804><s%> many such things <S%H7227><s%>: miserable <S%H5999><s%> comforters <S%H5162><s%> <S%H8764><s%> are ye all.
Shall vain <S%H7307><s%> words <S%H1697><s%> have an end <S%H7093><s%>? or what emboldeneth <S%H4834><s%> <S%H8686><s%> thee that thou answerest <S%H6030><s%> <S%H8799><s%> ?

I also could speak <S%H1696><s%> <S%H8762><s%> as ye do: if <S%H3863><s%> your soul <S%H5315><s%> were <S%H3426><s%> in my soul's <S%H5315><s%> stead, I could heap up <S%H2266><s%> <S%H8686><s%> words <S%H4405><s%> against you, and shake <S%H5128><s%> <S%H8686><s%> mine head <S%H7218><s%> at <S%H1119><s%> you.

But I would strengthen <S%H553><s%> <S%H8762><s%> you with <S%H1119><s%> my mouth <S%H6310><s%>, and the moving <S%H5205><s%> of my lips <S%H8193><s%> should asswage <S%H2820><s%> <S%H8799><s%> your grief.

Though I speak <S%H1696><s%> <S%H8762><s%>, my grief <S%H3511><s%> is not asswaged <S%H2820><s%> <S%H8735><s%>: and though I forbear <S%H2308><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, what am I eased <S%H1980><s%> <S%H8799><s%> ?
But now he hath made me weary <S%H3811><s%> <S%H8689><s%>: thou hast made desolate <S%H8074><s%> <S%H8689><s%> all my company <S%H5712><s%>.

And thou hast filled me with wrinkles <S%H7059><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, which is a witness <S%H5707><s%> against me: and my leanness <S%H3585><s%> rising up <S%H6965><s%> <S%H8799><s%> in me beareth witness <S%H6030><s%> <S%H8799><s%> to my face <S%H6440><s%>.

He teareth <S%H2963><s%> <S%H8804><s%> me in his wrath <S%H639><s%>, who hateth <S%H7852><s%> <S%H8799><s%> me: he gnasheth <S%H2786><s%> <S%H8804><s%> upon me with his teeth <S%H8127><s%>; mine enemy <S%H6862><s%> sharpeneth <S%H3913><s%> <S%H8799><s%> his eyes <S%H5869><s%> upon me.

They have gaped <S%H6473><s%> <S%H8804><s%> upon me with their mouth <S%H6310><s%>; they have smitten <S%H5221><s%> <S%H8689><s%> me upon the cheek <S%H3895><s%> reproachfully <S%H2781><s%>; they have gathered <S%H4390><s%> <S%H8691><s%> themselves together <S%H3162><s%> against me.

'Elohim <S%H410><s%> hath delivered <S%H5462><s%> <S%H8686><s%> me to the ungodly <S%H5760><s%>, and turned me over <S%H3399><s%> <S%H8804><s%> into the hands <S%H3027><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>.

I was at ease <S%H7961><s%>, but he hath broken me asunder <S%H6565><s%> <S%H8770><s%>: he hath also taken <S%H270><s%> <S%H8804><s%> me by my neck <S%H6203><s%>, and shaken me to pieces <S%H6327><s%> <S%H8770><s%>, and set me up <S%H6965><s%> <S%H8686><s%> for his mark <S%H4307><s%>.

His archers <S%H7228><s%> compass me round about <S%H5437><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, he cleaveth <S%H6398><s%> my reins <S%H3629><s%> asunder <S%H6398><s%> <S%H8762><s%>, and doth not spare <S%H2550><s%> <S%H8799><s%>; he poureth out <S%H8210><s%> <S%H8799><s%> my gall <S%H4845><s%> upon the ground <S%H776><s%>.
He breaketh <S%H6555><s%> <S%H8799><s%> me with breach <S%H6556><s%> upon <S%H6440><s%> breach <S%H6556><s%>, he runneth <S%H7323><s%> <S%H8799><s%> upon me like a giant <S%H1368><s%>.
I have sewed <S%H8609><s%> <S%H8804><s%> sackcloth <S%H8242><s%> upon my skin <S%H1539><s%>, and defiled <S%H5953><s%> <S%H8782><s%> my shofar <S%H7161><s%> in the dust <S%H6083><s%>.
My face <S%H6440><s%> is foul <S%H2560><s%> <S%H8777><s%> with weeping <S%H1065><s%>, and on my eyelids <S%H6079><s%> is the shadow of death <S%H6757><s%>;
Not for any injustice <S%H2555><s%> in mine hands <S%H3709><s%>: also my prayer <S%H8605><s%> is pure <S%H2134><s%>.
O earth <S%H776><s%>, cover <S%H3680><s%> <S%H8762><s%> not thou my blood <S%H1818><s%>, and let my cry <S%H2201><s%> have no place <S%H4725><s%>.
Also now, behold, my witness <S%H5707><s%> is in heaven <S%H8064><s%>, and my record <S%H7717><s%> is on high <S%H4791><s%>.
My friends <S%H7453><s%> scorn <S%H3887><s%> <S%H8688><s%> me: but mine eye <S%H5869><s%> poureth out <S%H1811><s%> <S%H8804><s%> tears unto 'Elohim <S%H433><s%>.
O that one might plead <S%H3198><s%> <S%H8686><s%> for a man <S%H1397><s%> with 'Elohim <S%H433><s%>, as a man <S%H120><s%> pleadeth for his neighbour <S%H1121><s%> <S%H7453><s%> !

When a few <S%H4557><s%> years <S%H8141><s%> are come <S%H857><s%> <S%H8799><s%>, then I shall go <S%H1980><s%> <S%H8799><s%> the way <S%H734><s%> whence I shall not return <S%H7725><s%> <S%H8799><s%>.
